title: Matching digits
explanation: Write a pattern that matches all the digit in the given text
hint: Charcter '/d' matches any digit, specify number of charters to take in curly braces '{}'

title: The Dot
explanation: Write a patter to find expected values
hint: Use dot a wildcard, it will match any charted '.', escape the dot with backslash to match actual dot

title: Charcter ranges
explanation: Write a pattern to find firs three word starting with uppercase character
text:
Ana
Bob
Cpc
aax
bby
ccz
hint: Use ranges in square brackets [A-Z] or [a-z]

title: Repetion of characters
explanation: Write a pattert to find expected results
text:
wazzzzzzzzup
wazzzzzzzup
wazzzzzup
wazzzzup
wazzzup
wazzup
wazup
hint: You can specify a range for character repetiion such tha a{1,3} no more than 3 times, but no less than once for example

title: Optional character
explanation: Write a pattert to find expected results
text:
1 error found
2 errors found
25 errors found
No errors found
expected:
1 error found
2 errors found
25 errors found
hint: You can add '?' after the character to specify that it is optional. For example, the pattern ab?c will match either the strings "abc" or "ac" because the b is considered optional.

title: Matching specific characters
hint: For finding any character defin them inside square brackets. For example, the pattern [abc] will only match a single a, b, or c letter and nothing else.

title: Final test
explanation: Extract all phone numbers from the message using regular expression
text: There are some phone numbers 816-333-1234. Also you can call me at 645.555.1234 and of course I'm always reachable at (542)867-5309
